title: Snowflake Melts on Contact With Cloud Washout
sub_head: Richest-valued cloud stock is the latest tripped up by a harsh sector selloff
body:
Not even Snowflake can compete with itself sometimes.
The cloud-software company was considered a hot property on its listing in September 2020 and has remained so ever since. Demand for its data-warehousing software used by enterprises to speed up their business-analytics abilities has kept growth off the charts. Revenue more than doubled on a year-over-year basis over the previous nine quarters ahead of Snowflakeâ€™s fourth-fiscal-quarter results Wednesday. Its latest report kept up the trend: Revenue surged 101% to about $384 million.
